Another study went a whisker further. Researchers raised two groups of kittens in the dark,
and when they were exposed to light they wore goggles that restricted them to see
in either horizontal lines or vertical lines.
When the goggles were removed, the cats were blind to lines running the other way.

The horizontal cats could sit on a chair,

vertical cats could avoid the chair legs,

The researchers discovered the visual cortex contains nerve cells called “feature detectors”

The cat’s brains dedicated these nerve cells to one orientation and neglected the other.
